Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the likelihood of the coronavirus going away without a vaccine.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the virus will go away without a vaccine.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the virus will simply disappear on its own, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the expert opinion that it is unlikely for the virus to go away without a vaccine.
Understate: None of the provided information suggests an understatement bias.
Falters at times: None of the provided information suggests a bias of faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the persistence of the virus.
